headline: Currently pursuing a master's in machine learning at Technical University of Denmark. When not studying I am an independent data scientist with a focus on health data and public health administration analytics.
summary: With ten years‚Äô experience with health data and statistical programming and data juggling in the public sector administration in Denmark, I began a new chapter in my work life as independent computer programmer in spring 2016. My main interest lies in technical solution for complex problems. In my work with health data, I have used the SAS-platform and development environment for anything ranging from simple statistical analysis to more advanced process automation and dynamically structed coding. Apart from that, I also enjoy coding in Python and can find my way around C/C++, Excel/VBA and R. I have a background in both mathematics and anthropology. This combination allows me to both understand abstract problems and translate them into concrete solutions, bridging the gap between the technical sphere and the human realm. 12 years experience as teaching assistant at the University of Copenhagen and the IT-University has taught me how to communicate complex theoretical material to new learners. I have a few steady customers, but If you need my help, I will probably have spare time for expanding my customer portfolio a bit. My technical experience can be summed up in the following: I am expert in: - Python (pytorch, numpy, scikit-learn, pandas etc) - SAS programming (base, macro, sql, dynamic coding, data wrangling etc.) - Data analytics - Machine Learning and Deep Learning Things that I'm also pretty good at: - Health Data (Danish National Patients Registry (LPR), all other Danish national patient registries such as the cancer registry, the birth registry etc.) - Algorithms and mathematical modelling - Project management - Statistical analysis Stuff that I know at an intermediate level - C/C++ - MS powershell - Linux - Excel/VBA Stuff that I know just well enough to allow me to cause a major fuckup: - coming soon!
location_full: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

experience.description: With ten years‚Äô experience with health data from public administration in Denmark, I chose to start as independent data analyst in 2016. In my role as consultant, I have worked with data extraction from various national patients registries, and statistical analysis for a book on citizens health. The majority of my clients come from the public health administration in Denmark.

Teaching assistant in the course Digital Management, Governance and Accountability at the IT-University of Copenhagen. Drawing on my experience from the Danish Central administration, I provided students with an understanding of the political, ethical, cultural and legal context of management, governance and accountability relations surrounding IT and IT-development.
experience.company_hq_full_address: Rued Langgaards Vej 7; Copenhagen S, 2300, DK

experience.description: In the course Anthropological Methods, the student were introduced to a variety of ethnographic methods, while relating them to the relevant discussions in the philosophy of the science of anthropology. As teaching assistant I carried out exercise classes and gave a series of lectures on quantitative methods.

At the Institute, I worked in the section that caters to the financing of the Danish health sector. My portfolio included the following. ‚Ä¢ Project management in a sub-project regarding the development of the new National Patients Registry (LPR3). ‚Ä¢ Chair of the Nordic Medico-Statistical Committee (NOMESCO). The Committee works under the Nordic Council of Ministers and is tasked with: working to ensure that health statistics in the Nordic Countries is comparable between countries; gathering statistics within this field; presenting these statistics and making them widely available. For further information, please visit www.nowbase.org. ‚Ä¢ Coordinator of international relations. As coordinator I have organized a study trip to Qatar for twelve leading personalities in the health finance sector in Denmark. Furthermore, I organized and coordinated delivery of health statistics to international organizations. ‚Ä¢ Project management of automation project. The project aims to automate the production of Danish health data and health statistics; to stabilize production; and to provide a secure framework for automated data production. ‚Ä¢ Lots of SAS coding. ‚Ä¢ Providing health statistics to international organizations (OECD, NOMESCO, and EUROSTAT etc.), public media and the Danish parliament. Show less
experience.company_name: Department for Health Data, National Institute for Health Data and Disease Control

experience.description: The Research Services provide researchers with health data from the national Danish health registries. At this position I carried out the following tasks. ‚Ä¢ SAS programming. ‚Ä¢ Data extraction from national health registries for research projects. ‚Ä¢ Supervision of researchers working with Danish health data. ‚Ä¢ Project management. ‚Ä¢ Quality assurance of the departments codebase. ‚Ä¢ Data security strategies.
experience.company_name: Research Services Section, National Institute for Health Data and Disease Control

experience.description: At the Department, I held a position as teaching assistant in the following courses. Teaching assistant in Philosophy of Science in Anthropology. The course was a highly intensive introduction to philosophy of science of anthropology. We covered early 20th century analytical philosophers and a range of continental philosophers. The teaching method took the shape of lecturing and class discusions. Teaching assistant in Quantitative methods. I taught basic statistical inference, SPSS and survey studies. I lectured, had class discussions and held workshops with the students. Show less
experience.company_name: Dept. of Anthropology, University of Copenhagen

experience.description: I held a 6 months internship at the Royal Danish Embassy in Nairobi, during which, I worked with the Danida Health Sector Programme in Kenya. I had responsibilities and learnt about the following. ‚Ä¢ Project management and follow-up. ‚Ä¢ Development and health economics. ‚Ä¢ Health planning. ‚Ä¢ Public sector management. At the Embassy, I developed strong intercultural communications skills, as I was working in close collaboration with the Kenyan Ministry of Medical Services, and specifically with the team developing the Health Information System. Show less

As student assistant, my tasks included the following. ‚Ä¢ SAS programming. ‚Ä¢ Maintenance of the National Patients Registry. ‚Ä¢ Descriptive statistics for use in publications from the Board. ‚Ä¢ Descriptive statistical material for press releases on various health related subjects. ‚Ä¢ Health statistics for the Danish Parliament. ‚Ä¢ Data extraction from national health registries for research projects.
experience.company_name: National Board of Health, Department of Health Documentation

experience.description: I have been assigned as instructor to the Department of Mathematical Sciences, various other departments for a number of years. During this time, I have taught the following courses repeatedly. The teaching methods varied between individualized exercise classes, computer classes and class exercises. ‚Ä¢ Introduction to mathematics (mathematical analysis). ‚Ä¢ Linear Algebra I. ‚Ä¢ Mathematical models in biology. ‚Ä¢ Introduction to microeconomics. ‚Ä¢ Mathematics and Data Processing for Bioscience. Show less
experience.company_name: Faculty of Science, University of Copenhagen

education.description: Time Series Analysis (02417) Stochastic dynamic models. Linear stochastics process models (ARMA; ARX; Box-Jenkins; GLM; OE; ARIMA; Seasonal models; etc.). Correlation functions. Predictions in time series. Understand and implement the Kalman filter. Regression based methods for time series. Computer Architecture and Engineering (02155) Introduction to computer organization and instruction sets. Organization of the processor in a modern RISC-computer (control unit, data path, pipelining). Memory hierarchies, cache memories and virtual memory. New architectures which exploit different forms of parallelism. 02450 Introduction to Machine Learning and Data Mining Feature extraction and dimensionality reduction. Similarity measures and summary statistics. Overfitting and generalization. Classification (decision trees, nearest neighbor, naive Bayes, neural networks, and ensemble methods.). Linear regression. Clustering (k-means, hierarchical clustering, and mixture models.). Show less

education.description: During my master‚Äôs degree in anthropology, I covered developed end carried out a substantial independent research project. The master‚Äôs include the following subjects. ‚Ä¢ Research project design and planning. ‚Ä¢ Analysis of field material. ‚Ä¢ Contemporary anthropological theory. ‚Ä¢ Electives in Gender and in Violence. ‚Ä¢ One semester field work in Nairobi on the collaboration between youth groups and policing authorities. ‚Ä¢ Master thesis: Policing the Margins of the State ‚Äì Community policing in Kibera, Nairobi. Show less
education.activities_and_societies: Activities and Societies: Deputy Chair of the Study Board, Chair of the Students Council.

education.description: I pursued studies in mathematics and philosophy for three years, with a one-year gap in between in 2001-2005 and then finished up after my BS in anthropology. Studying math has taught me to think abstractly and scientifically. ‚Ä¢ I prioritized mathematical analysis and algebra, and wrote my bachelor‚Äôs thesis on universal algebra, which is a generalization of the concept of algebra. ‚Ä¢ I followed courses in statistics and computer science. ‚Ä¢ I took a minor in philosophy, where I especially enjoyed philosophy of science. This also gave me an interest in logic and philosophy of language, which is one of the intersections of math and philosophy. Show less

I received a bachelor‚Äôs degree in anthropology from University of Copenhagen in 2008. My training includes the following topics. ‚Ä¢ Qualitative methods ‚Äì various interview and observational techniques. ‚Ä¢ Quantitative methods ‚Äì introductory statistical analysis and survey design. ‚Ä¢ Project design ‚Äì how to design applied anthropological projects. ‚Ä¢ Research communication. ‚Ä¢ Regional and thematic courses in anthropological theory and analysis. ‚Ä¢ History of Anthropology. During my studies, I have ‚Äì among other things ‚Äì made a quantitative analysis of people's opinions about the real estate market and conducted a short fieldwork at a police station in Copenhagen. My stay in Havana formed the basis for my bachelor‚Äôs thesis. Show less
